name: ego
headline: AI-native 3D simulation engine
description:
We’re building the first generative ai-powered simulation engine, where non-technical creators can generate realistic characters powered by LLMs, 3D worlds, and interaction code/scripts with just prompts. The future of user-generated simulations, games, and interactive media will be powered by our engine.

We used our engine to build TownWorld - a 3D interactive Twitch live stream of the Stanford generative agents paper (https://www.twitch.tv/townworld). To the best of our knowledge, it's the first ever AI 3D simulation of a small town in real time

YC Launch - https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/KeD-ego-an-ai-native-3d-simulation-engine-getting-us-closer-to-the-matrix-one-pixel-at-a-time

Demo video: https://docsend.com/view/mzf6i7kiwkkgg669

AI 3D TownWorld video: https://docsend.com/view/ig6t2shuz26z7wha

founders.name: Peggy Wang, Founder
founders.description: Peggy is the Co-Founder and CTO of Ego. Before starting Ego, Peggy worked as a Computer Vision Engineer building ML Face Tracking for AR Avatars at Meta Reality Labs. She also worked on Behavior Planning for Autonomous Driving at Lyft Level 5, and depth sensing using 3D LiDAR point clouds at Oculus. Peggy graduated with her Master's and Bachelor's in Computer Science, AI track from Stanford. She did research in Behavior Planning, Controls, and Deep RL for robots

**Company Overview: Ego**

**Mission:**  
Ego is on a quest to redefine the future of simulations with its AI-native 3D simulation engine. The vision is pretty ambitious: to empower non-technical creators to generate realistic characters, immersive 3D worlds, and interactive experiences with simple prompts. Think of it as the canvas for user-generated simulations, games, and interactive media of tomorrow.

**Origins:**  
Founded in 2023 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W24, Ego emerged from the need for more accessible and powerful simulation tools. Their initial product was the generative AI-powered simulation engine itself, which has already made a notable mark. A standout application of their technology is *TownWorld*, a real-time interactive 3D simulation of a small town inspired by Stanford's generative agents paper. This isn’t just a demo—it's possibly the first of its kind in the realm of real-time AI 3D simulations.

**Team & Location:**  
Based in San Francisco, Ego operates with a compact team of five. The diversity in skill sets enables them to innovate rapidly while retaining clarity of purpose. They lean on Diana Hu as their Group Partner for strategic guidance.

**Tagline:**  
Ego is tagged with keywords that paint a solid picture of its focus: artificial intelligence, generative AI, consumer, gaming, and, of course, its home turf in the San Francisco Bay Area—an ecosystem thriving with innovation.

**Current Activities:**  
At present, the company is actively engaging users and building a community around its offerings. They have a waitlist for eager creators and are utilizing their engine to bridge the gap between imagination and creation.

**Demo & Launch:**  
For those interested in visualizing what Ego is building, there's a demo video showcasing the potential of their simulation engine, alongside a dedicated Twitch stream that illustrates real-time interactions in TownWorld. You can dive into the experience on their website: [Ego Live](https://ego.live) or check out their launch page on Y Combinator for more insights and updates.

**Summary:**  
Ego is not just another tech startup; it's a potential game-changer for content creation, making the complex world of 3D simulation accessible to all. If you're a creator—especially one who has felt constrained by technical hurdles—Ego might just be the key to unlocking your full potential in the digital landscape. Keep an eye on them; they’re building a fascinating future one pixel at a time.
